en: A photograph of the Buchenwald Concentration camp hospital with visitors sitting on the lawn and touring the facility. One doctor in a white coat stands at the top of the stairs, watching the scene. The camp at this time had been evacuated by the Nazis prior to American invasion in April, 1945.  After the war Buchenwald was used to house German war criminals and used by the Soviet Union, who killed as many as 10,000-20,000 from 1945-1950. The camp was demolished in 1950, but the crematorium, hospital block and two towers remain.
Era 8 - The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945)

After the war Buchenwald was used to house German war criminals and used by the Soviet Union, who killed as many as 10,000-20,000 from 1945-1950. The camp was demolished in 1950, but the crematorium, hospital block and two towers remain.
University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections
